readability_reflection: The approach I found more readable was the approach using  +'s and variables (string concatenation). It's easier to read and understand "My name is " + name. This method helps create a more distinct code.
comprehension_debugging: Yes, they did since it's easier for me to read concatenation, it allowed me to read and debug the code a lot faster.
preference_rationale: String concatenation because of the easier readability. Interpolation made it harder to find what each variable would connect with which.
learning_curve: I have no familiarity with string interpolation, so it was a lot more difficult to understand it. I've coded my whole life using concatenation, so it was naturally easier to understand it.
suggestions_improvement: I think interpolation could use another symbol rather than { } because it sometimes gets hard to differentiate between a regular ().
